title: A Song Of Praise For Karcist Alka

The following is a translation of a song originating from [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-2133|SCP-2133-1]]]. It was first recorded by foundation operatives in 1993, and has been documented several dozen times since. Each recording occurred during SCP-2133-1's working hours, with three or more singers participating in each recorded instance. It should be noted that lyrical accuracy has been prioritized over maintaining the rhythm of the original.

> We toil yet-endless in fields that feed not
> We breathe affliction[[footnote]] Translator's note: Originally "Baihteuk" a word meaning both illness and gift, depending on context  [[/footnote]], offer our bodies
> We commune in the fissure temple, red
> We work in rows for her harvest, red too
> 
> We work yet-endless in fields that feed not
> We cleanse from sin, repent with addled[[footnote]] Translator's note: Originally "Maušae" a word roughly meaning " altered or reconstructed", carries largely positive connotations [[/footnote]] hands
> We work for her, long for her bosom, red
> We work in rows for her harvest, red too
> 
> We die yet-endless in fields that feed not
> We do not reach paradise, forgotten
> We are bred, carried, born in the earth, red
> We work in rows for her harvest, red too
> 
> We grow[[footnote]] Translator's note: Originally "Vipevá" a word meaning "a cyclical or stable mutation", not implying an increase in number, sometimes used to refer to the growth of a child, hence the use of "grow" in this translation opposed to alternatives such as "Mutate", "propagate" or "continue" [[/footnote]] yet-endless in fields that feed not
> we work in rows for her harvest, red
